intro: Oncostemum longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed oncostemum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and elliptic in shape, with a smooth surface. Oncostemum longipes is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
